Well, i have just finished the main 4 (hl1, hl2, hl2 ep 1, hl2 ep 2), and this is my favorite of the 4. all of them are good, but this is my favorite. I didn't play opposing force or blue shift. Although, i didn't realize it until much later in this Half-Life marathon, but half life is very different to many other shooters. You dont constantly heal, and you cant hold onto medkits. Its not really level based, just running and shooting. There isn't much else, due to the fact that it was the start of a now legendary series, and i got this game for about 1 dollar, definetily worth the extra 10.

Ještě včera tu visela moje pozitivní recenze z roku 2019 na tento "port". V ní jsem hlavně hodnotil původní dílo z roku 1998 a mé zážitky zkreslené tím, že jsem se dohrál sotva do třetiny této hry. Dnes jsem se rozhodl celou tuto recenzi přepsat a hlavně vyjádřit názor na tento v opravdu velkých uvozovkách "remaster". Remastery by měly mít dvě základní vlastnosti. Zaprvé by měly vylepšit a opravit základní dílo a zadruhé by neměly přidat do díla nové, do té doby neexistující, problémy. A ani jedno tato hra, ve své době prezentovaná jako remaster, nedělá. Grafika je mimo několika detailů identická, akorát někdy díky přidaným odleskům vypadá hůř, a nových chyb je tu požehnaně od levitujících vědátorů až po epileptické obrazce v některých lokacích. Jednoduše nevidím důvod, proč si místo původní plně funkční verze kupovat tento port. Pokud už chcete lepší zážitek, než máte u původní verze, tak si pořiďte Black Mesa.

Pros:
+Ragdolls
+Better water
+Shadows
+Motion blur
Cons;
-Broken lighting
-Bugs
-Broken textures
Conclusion:
If you want to play Half-Life on source engine, play Black-Mesa. It's much better, you can interact with the world and everything is much better. You can play Half-Life too.

En sí el juego es Half-Life es por ello que es la historia y las dinámicas nunca van a decepcionar, sin embargo al ser una "remasterización" no incluye nada nuevo, ni siquiera un mejor modelado de las armas o de los npc's, decepciona saber que al incluir el motor gráfico Source no agrega nada que pueda explotar o innovar gracias a las posibilidades que pudo habernos demostrado. En definitiva, si quieres jugar una verdadera remasterización con el motor gráfico Source, compra Black Mesa y no HL:S

Half-Life Source attempts to port over the original Half-Life to the Source engine and uses the advantages and upgrades from the engine in an attempt to bring a better experience. Unfortunately, what it attempts to achieve falls flat in execution.

I won’t lie though, there are some positives for owning and playing Half-Life Source
+ Better light reflections from weapons
+ Better water, in texture and transparency 
+ Some areas have better lighting
+ Ragdolls
+ Prop physics
+ More console commands to play around with
+ And the ability to use it’s assets in Garry’s mod, including Maps, Weapons, NPCs, and Props

But there are many negatives
- This is only a Half-Life 1 port, so no official Opposing Force or Blue Shift campaign is available
- You can’t play any Half-Life 1 mods with HL Source unless they were ported over, which many aren't.
- Some areas have worse lighting than before
- Some reflections look bad and out of the artstyle
- Newer updates have broken lighting in a few areas
- Longer loading times (about 10 times longer than normal Half-Life believe it or not)
- Quick saving might freeze the game for 5 to 20 seconds
- It’s buggy (Final boss kept crashing the game and had to noclip to complete it)
- Death Match has it’s own EXE file
- And many of the advantages Valve could have used with Source aren't used and feels more like a copy and paste job.

Overall, HL:S is a mediocre remaster of the original Half-Life, adding a few neat extra lighting and ragdoll elements at the cost of stability, longer loading times, and not using the lighting elements well all the time. And the amount of mods available are very lacking compared to it’s younger brother.

Stick to the original Half-Life. I would only recommend getting HL:S if you're buying it from the “Valve Complete Pack” Bundle and use it’s assets for Gmod. If you want a modern remake of Half-Life, then Black Mesa is something you might wanna look into. Black Mesa actually uses tons of the advantages of using Source, as well as changing level geometry for a whole new experience. It also has Death Match and built-in Steam Workshop Support.

I replayed this the weekend before Half-Life: Alyx releases in order to go through a refresh on what happens in the original events of the game. Last time I played this was over a decade ago when the 'Source' version first released. I don't remember having such a hard time with this game, let alone the handful of bugs you will assuredly encounter. 

I'm glad I replayed this, but I must say... I wish I had played the 'Black Mesa' remake instead. I did not realize that finally released a couple of weeks ago and sure as hell looks like a better game. That said, if you're playing this for the first time, throw it on easy and fly through it, you're in for a classic!

The gameplay is very good.  However it is so incredibly buggy that it becomes unbearable.  DO NOT PLAY THIS GAME!  Instead play the normal non-source version.

It's Half-Life, but rebuilt in the Source engine. This fixes quite a few bugs with the old Goldsrc engine, and introduces a few new ones. There's not really that much to see here, especially if you've already played the original Half-Life. Go play Black Mesa if you want to experience Half-Life as a more modern game, and go play it with the original engine if you want the compleatly original experience. Otherwise, this is a neat novelty though, and might be worth checking out if you got it as part of a bundle or something.

I initially got this game believing it would be the definitive Half-Life experience from Valve. However, it turned out to be a buggy mish-mash of Half-Life and Half-Life 2 that can be jarring to see and play. I'd recommend getting the vanilla, GoldSRC engine based game titled only 'Half-Life' on Steam along with its Gearbox created expansions - 'Half-Life: Opposing Force' and 'Half-Life: Blue Shift'. As for the graphically enhanced (actual) Source engine experience, go for the outstanding 'Black Mesa' by Crowbar Collective also available on Steam.

Takes a little bit of work to get it up and running, but it sure does look nice. Unlike "Black Mesa" this is a direct port of Half-Life into the Source engine, with all of the annoying problems that go into it (e.g. some platforms are too small). Overall, Half-Life is a really fun game, and this is a great way to play the original game with some updated graphics.
This is not ass good as the original unlike I originally have said, but I think it's worth to try out.

Half Life ist eine tolle Spielreihe, aber dieses "Remake" ist eine wahre katastrophe!

Events werden nicht richtig geladen was verbugte Gegner und Türen / Lüftungsschachtgitter zu Folge hat.
Die Waffen haben bei mir ihre komplette Munition resettet ab einem gewissen Spielstand, den ich nicht genau kenne.
Die Waffen machen beim Nachladen keinen Sound und man wird förmlich nur mit Munition und Medikits zugemüllt was das spiel zu keiner Herausforderung macht, was das PVE angeht...
Durchspielen konnte ich es leider nicht, weil sich gewisse Knöpfe nicht drücken lassen wollten, obwohl alle nötigen Events dafür erledigt wurden.
Zudem habe ich einen ungewollten Godmodebug gegen dieses Krakenmonster mit den 3 Klauen, weswegen es mir keinen Schaden macht während alle anderen Monster mir sehr wohl schaden können.

Hätte ich gewusst wie schlimm die Lage mit den bugs ist, hätte ich lieber das alte "Half Life" von 1998 gespielt als diese Bughölle namens: "Half Life Source".
